g:HTMLPanel.h1: Welcome! Here's How to Get Started.
g:HTMLPanel.p: LACE is a tool for editing PDS4 label files and other XML files, developed by the User Centered Design group at NASA Ames Research Center. The User Centered Design group is a function of NASA's Planetary Data System.

This screen is the Label Manager which list the labels you have created or imported. From here you can resume editing any of your labels, or delete labels you no longer need. To edit a label, click on the label name.

All your labels are stored on the LACE server. Whenever you make changes while editing a label, those changes are stored on the LACE server, so you will never lose your work by accidentally closing your browser.

To edit an existing label from that is on your computer you must import the file into LACE. This sends the file to the LACE server. All editing changes are stored on the server. Your local file is not modified.

If you want to get the latest version of the label from the server to your local computer, you must export the label file. First begin editing the label by clicking on the label name. Then press the Export Label button at the top of the screen.

LACE supports local data dictionary XML Schema and Schematron files. Several released discipline-specific schemas are already available in LACE. To add more XML Schema or Schematron files, you can specify them when creating a new label or importing an existing label file.
When you're ready, click the Create New Label button or the Import Existing Label button above to start editing your first label.
